msDesc.head: Thomas Chillenden, Reportata in Clementinas, Reportorium quarti libri decretalium; Dino de Mugello, Super regulis juris; Johannes Andreae, De sponsalibus et matrimoniis

msItem.incipit: Johannes Episcopus conclusio pan. Papa multis modis et nominibus appelatur fol. 1r
msItem.explicit: temporales vel claustrales syndicus et consilia fol. 89v
msItem.author: Thomas Chillenden (d. 1411)
msItem.title: Reportata in Clementinas.

note.p: Unprinted. For other manuscripts see BRUO, s.n.

Fols. 29v-30v are blank but comparison with the text in Oxford, New College, MS 204 shows that our text is continuous. A gap of three-quarters of a page on fol. 82v gives warning of the absence here of text corresponding to fols. 386va and 389vb of the New College manuscript.
Fol. 90rv is blank except for Chycelden on the verso (s. xv).

msItem.incipit: Premissis casibus singularibus et eorum determinacione fol. 91r
msItem.explicit: cum pater s dulcissimus et de legatis iij I. nomen non s ultimo. Explicit tractatus domini digni super titulo de regulis juris etc. Manus scriptoris careat grauitate doloris. fol. 126v
msItem.author: Dino de Mugello
msItem.title: Super regulis juris

note.p: Pr. Rome, 1472, etc. (Hain 6171-80). On Dino (fl. s. xiiiex) see L. Falletti, in Dict. de droit canon. iv (1949), 1250-7; LexMA iii (1986), cols. 1068-9 and references. On the text see P. Stein, Regulae juris (Edinburgh, 1966), 148-53.

msItem.incipit: De francia. Sic sumitur mulier lege saxonum ducta fol. 128r
msItem.explicit: de prescriptis .c. finali qui ciuil' per b' et ho. Deo gracias Explicit. Explicit reportorium libri decretalium per magistrum Thomam child chyseldene doctore in decretis. 194v
msItem.author: Thomas Chillenden
msItem.title: Reportorium quarti libri decretalium.
msItem.note: Unprinted, and no other manuscript recorded in BRUO.

msItem.incipit: Propri nomen invocamus ad honorem ipsius 195r
msItem.explicit: vnde quid vide per te. Explicit Summa Joannes andree doctoris decretorum super iiijto libro decretalium. 198r
msItem.author: Johannes Andreae
msItem.title: De sponsalibus et matrimoniis (Super quarto libro decretalium)

note.p: Pr. Basel, 1473/5 (Hain 1069, Hain/Copinger 1068, GW 1751): for other early editions see Hain 1068,1070-6. On the work see Schulte, ii. 214-16.

msItem.incipit: Rubrica ista continuatur ad precedentes sub hac forma 200r
msItem.explicit: et non ad venacionem contra pan. 233v
msItem.title: Reportata on the Clementines.

note.p: The tituli covered, not in the order of the Clementines, are (fol. 200r) De officio et potentate iudicis delegati; (fol. 214r) De censibus; (fol. 219v) De prescriptis; (fol. 220v) De regularibus transeuntibus; (fol. 226r) De statu monachorum et canonicorum regularium. Apparently not by Thomas Chillenden (cf. item 1 above): the text does not correspond to Chillenden's in New College, MS 204.
Fol. 234r is blank. Fol. 234v: see History below

support.p: Written on 234 leaves of good-quality paper, with reinforcing strips of parchment around quires, preceded by two membrane flyleaves and followed by two others. Some of the strips come from a document of s. xiii, and others from a necrology of s. xiv with columns of Christian names (parts only) preceded by pro anima; no place names remain.

p.watermark: Watermarks are (fol. 115) horn, very close to Piccard, Wassezzeichen Horn, type VI, no. 229 (Pisa, 1380, 1381); (fol. 131) crossbow and arrow, very close to Piccard, Wasseizeichen Werkzeuge and Waffin ii, type x, no. 1388 (Treviso, 1388); (fol. 170), cutlass, Briquet 5156 (Pisa, 1390); (fol. 198) letter M, not in Briquet; (fol. 12), axe, Briquet, 7505 (Low Countries, Italy, etc., 1378-1412).

support.p: Fore- and endleaves: fol. ir, number; fol. iv, pen-trial; fol. iir, number; fol. iiv, ex libris and pen-trial; fol. Ir pen-trials; fol. Iv-IIv blank.

collation.signatures: Quires 9, 12-13, 14-16 bear quire numbers in the form primus qo (or iius or iiius etc. plus qo: quires 15-16 lack qo) and a small roman figure; quire 14 is signed a-f on the first six leaves; quire 17 has rough roman numerals i-vi in hardpoint; quire 18 has small roman numerals i-vi.
collation.catchwords: The only catchwords are within quire 17, on fols. 200v, 201v, 210v, 211v.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in one column, fols. 1-199 230165 mm, 50 lines.
Occasional prickings for frame ruling are visible. Frame-ruled by hardpoint.

handDesc.handNote: Anglicana. Headings and some running titles are in a debased gothic bookhand, others are in anglicana formata.

decoDesc.decoNote: None. Spaces with guide letters were left for initials on fols. 128r and 195r

binding.p: Sewn on five bands between chamfered wooden boards covered with white alum-tawed sheepskin. On the spine is a black leather lozenge-shaped label with 2 on it. On the front cover are the remains of two straps originally held by five of the usual nails, of which one of the top ones is missing. On the back cover are two metal catches held by three of the usual nails. Above these, on the edge, are two holes from a chain-clasp (position 7). On the back cover the pastedown is a leaf from a 14th-century English missal, not noted, with two columns of text, each 85-90 mm wide(truncated at bottom but probably c.270 mm high) and written in gothica semiquadrata, with rubrics. The text is the office for the vigil of Christmas as far as the end of the gradual. The endbands are blue and white and edges are yellowed.

history.provenance:
On the front pastedown is Liber domini Simonis Northew Rectoris de Mechyng [Newhaven] Cicestrensis diocesis (s. xv1). At the bottom of fol. 2r is ex libris style 13, liber Collegij Animarum Oxon: Ker, All Souls, List ii, no. 308, with Libri iuris canonici distribuendi. The All Souls ex libris, style 2, is also on fol. iiv, Liber Collegii Omnium Animarum Fidelium Defunctorum de Oxon. Above that is what may be no more than a pen-trial, A mon treschier et amy (s. xv); on fol. 234v, in a hand of s. xv, is Adam bernar and, in the same hand, Per quadras fibres teneri signantur amores
Flores innumeri set amores vix duo veri; to the right of this but probably not connected is J. Godic ham in another hand of s. xv. BRUO equates the name Godeham or Gaham with Game, and a John Game was a fellow of All Souls who died in 1502. He gave a printed book to the College and although he was a Doctor of Medicine and not a canonist he may have had a connection with the present book. No. 1439 (38) in CMA.
history.acquisition: All Souls library identifications, on which see Introduction, are, on the front pastedown, vv.4.2, ss.2.2, and vv:6:2 (all deleted), MS. 53. (figure not added), 109 (pencil), and bookplate no. 8 on which is L.R. 2.b.9 (pencil); on fol. ir is 8..8 (pencil)

recordHist.source: Andrew G. Watson, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts of All Souls College Oxford (Oxford, 1997)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact library@all-souls.ox.ac.uk.
